remarks: Integration by parts.  If ` B ( x ) ` is the derivative of ` A ( x ) ` and ` D ( x ) ` is the derivative of ` C ( x ) ` , and ` E = ( A x. B ) ( X ) ` and ` F = ( A x. B ) ( Y ) ` , then under suitable integrability and differentiability assumptions, the integral of ` A x. D ` from ` X ` to ` Y ` is equal to ` F - E ` minus the integral of ` B x. C ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Sep-2014.)
statement:
itgparts.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. RR ) $.
itgparts.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. RR ) $.
itgparts.le $e |- ( ph -> X <_ Y ) $.
itgparts.a $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. ( X [,] Y ) |-> A ) e. ( ( X [,] Y ) -cn-> CC ) ) $.
itgparts.c $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. ( X [,] Y ) |-> C ) e. ( ( X [,] Y ) -cn-> CC ) ) $.
itgparts.b $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. ( X (,) Y ) |-> B ) e. ( ( X (,) Y ) -cn-> CC ) ) $.
itgparts.d $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. ( X (,) Y ) |-> D ) e. ( ( X (,) Y ) -cn-> CC ) ) $.
itgparts.ad $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. ( X (,) Y ) |-> ( A x. D ) ) e. L^1 ) $.
itgparts.bc $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. ( X (,) Y ) |-> ( B x. C ) ) e. L^1 ) $.
itgparts.da $e |- ( ph -> ( RR _D ( x e. ( X [,] Y ) |-> A ) ) = ( x e. ( X (,) Y ) |-> B ) ) $.
itgparts.dc $e |- ( ph -> ( RR _D ( x e. ( X [,] Y ) |-> C ) ) = ( x e. ( X (,) Y ) |-> D ) ) $.
itgparts.e $e |- ( ( ph /\ x = X ) -> ( A x. C ) = E ) $.
itgparts.f $e |- ( ( ph /\ x = Y ) -> ( A x. C ) = F ) $.
itgparts $p |- ( ph -> S. ( X (,) Y ) ( A x. D ) _d x = ( ( F - E ) - S. ( X (,) Y ) ( B x. C ) _d x ) ) $.
$d E x $.
$d F x $.
$d X x $.
$d Y x $.
$d ph x $.
